Traffic Light Demo

The classic traffic light pattern. In two variations. One literal, another more simple.

The principle is the same - evaluate a value and set the color based on your criteria. In this demo, the data to evaluate, query1, is a parse function. It returns a random integer, named val, between 0 and 30.

{ val: Math.floor(Math.random()*10) }

Based on the value returned, we either add an additional class or set the background color.

Here's how we turn on the red light in the 3-light traffic light:

<div class="light red {{? query1.val < 3}}on{{?}}"></div>

Above, we check if query.val is less than 10, and if so add an additional class named on to the red light.

For the simple traffic light, we set the background color based on the value of query1.val:

background-color: {{? query1.val < 3}}#fc625d{{?? query1.val < 6}}#fdbe40{{??}}#34cb4a{{?}};
